summary: Email chain regarding the FBI's delivery of two new drives from the U.S. Attorney's Office to the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) for Ghislaine Maxwell on January 11, 2021. The correspondence involves an Assistant U.S. Attorney, an FBI Special Agent, and likely a contractor or MDC staff member coordinating the logistics.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of two new drives being delivered to the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) by the FBI.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Coordinates the delivery of drives from their office to the MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell, with the FBI assisting.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Coordinating the delivery of the drives to the MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Working together to coordinate the delivery of drives to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC.
Prosecutor involved in the case against the defendant, facilitating delivery of materials to her.
FBI agent involved in delivering materials to the defendant in custody.

events.title: Drive Delivery to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The FBI delivers two new drives from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On January 11, 2021, the FBI coordinated the delivery of two new drives to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).
The drives originated from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney and an FBI Special Agent were directly involved in arranging the delivery logistics.
The email chain shows ongoing legal and logistical activity in Maxwell's case in early 2021.
